availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George C. McFadden (Peoria County, Illinois, merchant, hotelkeeper, and sheriff.)

body.p: Peoria County, Illinois, merchant, hotelkeeper, and sheriff. New York native. Married to Jeaniette McFadden. Father of Thomas B. McFadden, Mary J. McFadden, John McFadden, Sarah McFadden, and Almira McFadden. Merchant in Peoria County, Illinois, in 1850. Hotelkeeper in Peoria County in 1860. Sheriff of Peoria County from November 1864 to November 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, Peoria County, Peoria, p. 149A
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Peoria County, Peoria Ward 2, p. 89.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Iowa, Boone County, Boonesboro, p. 45A.
The History of Peoria County, Illinois (Chicago: Johnson & Company, 1880), 348.
